info.title: PolicyClient
info.description: To manage and control access to your resources, you can define customized policies and assign them at a scope.

get.description: This operation retrieves the data policy manifest with the given policy mode.

parameters.name: policyMode
parameters.description: The policy mode of the data policy manifest to get.

200.description: OK - Returns information about a data policy manifest.

404.description: Not found - the data policy manifest doesn't exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: This operation retrieves a list of all the data policy manifests that match the optional given $filter. Valid values for $filter are: "$filter=namespace eq '{0}'". If $filter is not provided, the unfiltered list includes all data policy manifests for data resource types. If $filter=namespace is provided, the returned list only includes all data policy manifests that have a namespace matching the provided value.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of data policy manifests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

CloudError.description: An error response from a policy operation.

name.description: The function name as it will appear in the policy rule. eg - 'vault'.

fullyQualifiedResourceType.description: The fully qualified control plane resource type that this function represents. eg - 'Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults'.

defaultProperties.description: The top-level properties that can be selected on the function's output. eg - [ "name", "location" ] if vault().name and vault().location are supported

allowCustomProperties.description: A value indicating whether the custom properties within the property bag are allowed. Needs api-version to be specified in the policy rule eg - vault('2019-06-01').

standard.description: The standard resource functions (subscription and/or resourceGroup).

custom.description: An array of data manifest custom resource definition.

DataManifestResourceFunctionsDefinition.description: The resource functions supported by a manifest

namespaces.description: The list of namespaces for the data policy manifest.

policyMode.description: The policy mode of the data policy manifest.

isBuiltInOnly.description: A value indicating whether policy mode is allowed only in built-in definitions.

resourceTypeAliases.description: An array of resource type aliases.

fieldValues.description: The non-alias field accessor values that can be used in the policy rule.

resourceFunctions.description: The resource functions definition specified in the data manifest.

DataPolicyManifestProperties.description: The properties of the data policy manifest.

id.description: The ID of the data policy manifest.

name.description: The name of the data policy manifest (it's the same as the Policy Mode).

value.description: An array of data policy manifests.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the operation.

DataPolicyManifestsFilterParameter.name: $filter
DataPolicyManifestsFilterParameter.description: The filter to apply on the operation. Valid values for $filter are: "namespace eq '{value}'". If $filter is not provided, no filtering is performed. If $filter=namespace eq '{value}' is provided, the returned list only includes all data policy manifests that have a namespace matching the provided value.
